main event: Multiple observations of unidentified aerial objects in Dallas, Texas, on 21 May 1949, reported by various sources.
interesting points: Descriptions include 75-100 objects in a long, irregular line, smaller than a man's fist at arm's length, and flying in a fixed curve at high speeds.
One witness observed the objects while star gazing, and another witness mentioned the weather was clear, with occasional lightning.
Observers ranged from an agriculture teacher, construction and labor foreman, to a mail clerk and a sewing housewife.
The objects were reported to have various colors, shapes, and altitudes, and their manner of disappearance was noted as 'fading from sight.'
The reports were declassified after 12 years in accordance with DOD DIR 5200.10.
witnesses: diverse group including a group of civilians and a mail clerk
